page.title: 19Shopping and Trade
page.content: Most people rely on the Post Office Store in Brushford village for their daily needs, including newspapers, milk and bread. Some collect daily papers from the Post Office Store at Oldways End and the Sunday paper from the Oakford shop. These local shops are the heart of village life. Milk may be delivered, butcher and baker may deliver orders, a travelling outfitter comes from Tiverton and vans with fresh fish and vegetables visit the village weekly.Some hairdressers call at people's homes. People also shop in Dulverton,2miles and at weekly markets in Tiverton or South Molton, or at Cash-and-Carry stores in Tiverton, Rackenford, Minehead. Some go 20-26 miles to Taunton or Exeter.In Brushford, there are 3 builders,agricultural,coal, buil ders merchants and DIY equipment hire.
